comments.html: cynical certainly but probably very accurate.
comments.name: Conor F

comments.html:
You must have read only some of my blog posts ;) OpenFlow can be used or abused like any other technology. NEC uses is wisely, so does Nicira.

Floodlight (in its vanilla incarnation) is awful, some other ideas (load balancing with per-flow forwarding in Internet) are simply bizarre.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Wait, I thought this blog had established that OpenFlow is part of a recurring series of microflow failures (like IntServ). What is this interest on OpenFlow about?
comments.name: Dimitris T

comments.html:
It always amazes me what can be found on Wikipedia. Netscape still got acquired for $4.2B (by AOL, ha). Not too shabby.

Why do you have to be a cynic - can't we think, history WON'T repeat itself? :)

Thanks for sharing the Simon Wardley article. Enjoyed that one.
comments.name: Jason Edelman (@jedelman8)

comments.html: Very informative post as always, Ivan. This blog is almost like a home page to me...
